page.title: 04Triplex Glass---St.Helens
page.content: Triplex got its name from the three pieces of glass bonded together. Reginald Delpech founded Triplex in 1912.Today the owner of Triplex is Pilkington Brothers.The Eccleston factory was built in 1928.There are about 1000 people working at Triplex. The average wage is Â£150 a week.The hours of work,excluding overtime is 39 hours. 12,000 sq.m of glass arrive at the factory daily.27,000 pieces of glass are processed into either toughened glass or heated rear screens for the motor industry and other forms of transport.The most important firms it supplies are Ford,Austin-Rover,General Motors,Nissan,Jaguar,Rolls-Royce and Misubishi.Triplex also deliver to many small firms. In 1985 Triplex began making large, curved double-glazed units.
